title: Ramadan and Coronavirus: Breaking my fast on Zoom
description: How fasting in lockdown and isolation has changed Ramadan for young Muslims this year.

title: Coronavirus: 'We go hungry so we can feed our children'
description: A growing number of families are struggling to put food on the table during the coronavirus lockdown.

title: Nordic Islands seen in their 'surreal light'
description: The breathtaking landscapes of Iceland, Greenland, Norway and the Faroe Islands.

title: Quiz of the Week: On UFOs, lockdown loosening and more
description: How closely have you been paying attention to what's been going on during the past seven days?

title: A breakthrough approaches for solar power
description: Scientists are working on better solar cells that will turn more of the sun's rays into electricity.

title: How The Assistant exposes Hollywood's abuse silence
description: The movie which has roots in the exposure of power and abuse in the film industry after #MeToo.

title: Coronavirus: Three continents, four lives, one day
description: The stories of people who died on one day, from an exile who returned home to a disaster survivor.

title: Coronavirus: When your child's in intensive care with Covid-19
description: Two mothers tell the BBC about their experiences as their young children battled the virus.

title: Coronavirus: Intensive care night shift in pictures
description: ICU teams are on the frontline of the coronavirus pandemic, working to keep the most seriously ill patients alive.

title: Coronavirus: What it's like to be shielding in your twenties
description: Grace, 26, doesn't look it but she's deemed extremely vulnerable - here's how she's dealing with having to shield.

title: Coronavirus: A visual guide to the economic impact
description: Key maps and charts explain how the virus has impacted markets and businesses around the world.

title: Coronavirus: Boris Johnson to update UK on 'steps to defeat' the disease
description: Boris Johnson will lead the Downing Street briefing later for the first time since his return to work.

title: Coronavirus: 'Probable' government will miss 100,000 test target
description: Hospital chiefs say the figure is a "red herring" and the UK must move to mass testing.

title: Coronavirus: Eurozone economy shrinks at record rate
description: Single currency nations see a sharp fall in GDP during the first quarter of the year.

title: Liverpool mayor fears 'farcical' situation if league resumes
description: Liverpool mayor Joe Anderson says resuming the Premier League is a "non-starter" and fears a "farcical" situation if fans congregate outside Anfield.

title: ‘Justice not charity’ - the blind marchers who made history
description: Remembering the maverick blind campaigners who walked to London a century ago to demand equality.

title: Captain Tom Moore celebrates 100th birthday
description: The war veteran who has raised more than £30 million for the NHS has celebrated his milestone birthday in style.

title: Coronavirus: AstraZeneca teams up with Oxford University on vaccine
description: AstraZeneca will make and distribute Oxford University's Covid-19 vaccine if it proves effective.

title: Eastbourne man builds railway in his garden
description: The retired railway worker uses self-isolation to finish his dream project.

title: Coronavirus cure: When will we have a drug to treat it?
description: There are no drugs proven to help doctors treat the disease, but work is under way around the world.

title: Coronavirus: France offers subsidy to tempt lockdown cyclists
description: The country's minister for ecological transition says the move aims to keep pollution levels low.

title: Coronavirus: Watchdog threatens legal action on holiday refunds
description: Firms refusing refunds for cancelled holiday accommodation and weddings are under investigation.

title: Captain Tom Moore receives England cricket cap from Michael Vaughan
description: Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan presents Captain Tom Moore with an England cricket cap to "make him an official member of the England team" on his 100th birthday.

title: TMS to replay classic England matches, including Edgbaston 2005
description: Test Match Special will replay classic England matches in full throughout May, including the famous Edgbaston Test of 2005.

title: Rishi Kapoor: Bollywood's 'evergreen romantic' hero dies
description: Rishi Kapoor, whose career spanned five decades, was diagnosed with cancer in 2018.

title: Coronavirus: Sainsbury’s boss warns queues set to stay in place
description: The supermarket says socially-distanced queues are likely to remain "for the foreseeable future".

title: Noel Gallagher shares unreleased Oasis demo, Don't Stop
description: The star found the long-lost track while sorting through old CDs during the lockdown.

title: Jesse Lingard: Can you keep up with his 40-minute workout?
description: Man Utd's Jesse Lingard presents a 40-minute workout with three rounds of four sets of exercises, including cardio, core and strength - and a bonus round if you can hack it!

title: Female drivers to feature in every Extreme E team
description: Extreme E teams will field one female and one male driver during races when the new climate aware racing series begins in 2021.

title: The Papers: 'Baby BoJoy' and Captain Tom's 100th birthday
description: The birth of the PM's son with fiancee Carrie Symonds features on most of Thursday's front pages.

title: Coronavirus: Tube may be 'overwhelmed' when lockdown is lifted, report warns
description: Transport and police in London could come under great strain if restrictions are eased, a report warns.

title: Coronavirus: Japan's low testing rate raises questions
description: Japan's relatively low rate of virus testing raises questions about how it has tackled the pandemic.
